meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incommunicable.
meanings.sent1: The incommunicabilities of his emotions made it hard for him to express his feelings.
meanings.sent2: The incommunicabilities of her thoughts prevented her from sharing her ideas with others.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicabilities of the secret recipe led to much speculation among the family members.
meanings.sent4: The incommunicabilities of the ancient language echoed through the halls of the museum.
meanings.sent5: The incommunicabilities of the encrypted message puzzled the codebreakers for days.

meanings.definition: The inability to be communicated or shared.
meanings.sent1: The incommunicabilities of his pain made it hard for others to understand his suffering.
meanings.sent2: The incommunicabilities of her fears isolated her from seeking help.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicabilities of the wifi password caused frustration among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The incommunicabilities of the distant stars reminded him of his loneliness.
meanings.sent5: The incommunicabilities of the complex scientific theory left the students bewildered.
